detailsOfAchievement: ACHIEVEMENTS AND LESSONS LEARNT FROM LAST YEAR WORK SRI SAI MAHILA SANGAM is a community based organization which consists of an executive body, general body and staff who are working completely with service motto. Sri Sai MahilaSangam was established in 1999, Registration of Society 29th July 1999, Registration No. 5149/1999, AP (Telangana areas) Public Society, Registration Act 1350 Fasli (Act I of 1350 F). Sri Sai MahilaSangam community Organization is working with Children, youth, women, community and health programmes. FSW TARGETED INTERVENTION PROJECT: As a part of FSW targeted intervention project SSMS our origination working on health awareness programs has concentrating on promotion of awareness on HIV/AIDS and educating the key population on condom as well as STI problems. As the HIV/AIDS epidemic began to proliferate in the country India, the organization felt the urgent need to address the issue by way of generating awareness among high risk groups as well general population. Since Tuberculosis is one of the most opportunistic disease for the people suffering with HIV/AIDS as well the prevalence of Tuberculosis is considerably high among the developing countries, the issue of Tuberculosis is also addressed by way of creating awareness in our adopted area of operation. With gender inequality, health status and herein addition to the awareness programs; In this year one-one, one-group, focus group and counseling sessions were organized especially for sex workers and migraines labour in the Nacharam, Mallapur, Charlapalli, industrial areas and also in Kapra, Old Malkajgiri, Tarnaka, AdikmetHabsiguda,Balajinager, Barath Nager, Bollaram, Chennapuram, Indira Nager, Defiance colony, Dental college, Gowtham Nager, Lothukunta, Macha Bollaram, Nethaji Nager, Old Alwal, S.P. Nager, Safilguda, Vayupuri, Venkatapuram, and Yapral. By Commercial sex workers. Sexual transmission accounting or more than 75% of spread of HIV in the area. Activities of the Intervention The organization is implementing the Programme through core Components: 1. Behavior Change Communication 2. STD Care Services 3. Condom Promotion & Distribution Programme 4. Enabling Environment. 5. Referrals & Linkages 6. Community Mobilization Committees Formation in the Programme: 1. Project Advisory Committee The Committee is Comprising of 9 members is representing 1/3 from programme Administration, 1/3 from Outreach Team and 1/3 from Community People. The basic aims and objective this committee to organize the review meetings for quarterly once and review the programme plans vs Achievements for the three months period and identify the gaps forms the review in each component and takes the resolutions for recommendations to take up on priority basis. 2. Crisis Management and Advocacy Committee The Committee is formed to response the community issues regarding any violence, discrimination, police harassment, gundas harassment etc. This committee to advocate the problem for smooth full solution and sensitize the issues at anywhere in project services on priority basis. The committee comprises of 7 members team, 2 from the project team, 1 from the Outreach team, 3 from the community and 1 from the out sourcing lawyer, the team is very active in the issues of community issues. They are organizing the legal literacy camps in DIC and Hotspot level for creating the awareness on District Legal Services Authority for free legal Advices, Domestic Violence Act-2005, ITPA Act etc. CBO Formation: In this Year, we have complete the CBO registration, to startup the some of the activities for supporting to programme. And to form a Hotspot Level Leaders; to sensitization to the key population, prior response to crisis management, developing health seeking behavior among key population and negotiating with pimps and madams for consistence use of condom by the key population. ï¶ SSMS has strong networking linkages with Govt. detailsOfAchievement: SRI VENKATESWARA NATYA MANDALI SURABHI, a family based professional theatre, with 28 plays in its repertoire, since 1937, developing the theatre arts, touring throughout the country, erecting their own temporary SURABHI THEATRE with zinc sheets and gunny bag cloth giving public performances of plays and lectures in ancient drama literature, stage designing, makeup and acting by experts in the combined states of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana regions in all the districts, often, participating in State, National and International levels, developing cultural interest to the public, providing pensions for the poor retired artists, taking care of health needs, education to their children, promoting unity among various cultural fields, under the leadership of PADMASHRI REKANDAR NAGESWARA RAO Alias Surabhi Babji since 42 years. The Surabhi theatre group generally, camping in several places, going on tour, erecting their own temporary mobile theatre, scheduling five performances of plays in a week, nearly 250 performances are being staged in a camp. The Surabhi theatre group gave its performances in the National School of Drama, New Delhi, Alarippu, New Delhi and R.R.C. Bangalore, under the direction and Music of PADMASRI B.V.KARANTH JI, BHEESHMA, CHANDIPRIYA, AND BASTHI DEVATHA YADAMMA adaptation of the good woman of Setzuan dramas. Workshops were conducted and training was given to our organization artists of younger generation in the modern theatre, for a period of 40 days to each play during 1996, 1997 and 1998. On the occasion of 125 years of SURABHI BIRTHDAY CELEBRATIONS I.G.N.C.A in collaboration with N.S.D, NEW DELHI jointly conducted the Surabhi Dramas from 22nd February, 2010 to 7th March, 2010 at New Delhi in a GRAND MANNER and marked as INTERNATIONAL SURABHI THEATRE FESTIVAL. We gave our performances of our theatre on the 4th Poorvottar Natya Samaroh, I.G.N.C.A. New Delhi on the occasion of MAHABHARATHA FESTIVAL 2011 Our Surabhi Theatre organization were invited to the Passages 2013 Festival at Metz and Paris in France, with 45 member artists and technicians for the performances of 18 shows for a period of 35 days. Our Surabhi Theatre organization was the one and the only from the outside the continent of Europe and from our continent Asia. During the Festival at Metz Aurelie Filipetti, Minister for Culture, France, and the Indian Embassy all the way travelling from Paris attended only for our performances and witnessed our play Bhakta Prahlada. The Honble Mayor, Metz city, France, inviting the entire Surabhi Theatre family, honored Surabhi Babji with a Gold medal.

detailsOfAchievement: Sri Rekandar Venugopal Rao belongs to the reputed Telugu Family Theatre popularly known as SURABHI, with an unbroken family tradition from 1885 in Chakraipeta Mandal, Cuddapah District, Andhra Pradesh. This perhaps, is the only theater in India with a history of 131 years. I am the 5th generation artist from Surabhi family. All my great ancestors right from Sri Vanarassa Gonvinda Rao, Pedda Rama Rao, Koteswar Rao, Narsimha Rao were all great Telugu Playwrightes and theatre artists who had dedicated their lives for preservation of Telugu Plays. Like the ancestors, 5th generation first son of Sri R. Narasimha Rao (father) and Smt. R. Sarojinin Devi (Mother) Sri Venugopal Rao born in 24th February 1962 in the place Numberpoolakunta Village, Andhra Pradesh State was started acting career in the Telugu theater at the age of 5 years as Bhakta Prahlada. From this child role onwards, I acted in various roles till today. I being the 5th generation of the Surabhi family, since my childhood, I dedicated my life completely for upliftment of Natyamandi, primarily as artist and subsequently as Director and presently the Natya Mandali is being run under my leadership. The latest creation is â€œSeetha Rama Kalyanamâ€, Pouranika Drama acted and directed by me i.e., Sri R. Venugopal Rao.
